intro: Epacris pilosa, commonly known as the hairy epacris, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant produces spikes of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to white, typically blooming in spring. Epacris pilosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract native pollinators.
